business.headline: Byju's founder told US ally to flee the US to avoid testifying: ReportThe businessman, William R. Hailer, testified before US Bankruptcy Judge John T. Dorsey, alleging that Byju Raveendran offered him a lucrative job and sent him a $10,700 plane ticket to Dubai just two days before he was scheduled to testify.

Sensex ends nearly 2,000 points higher, Nifty above 23,900A broad-based recovery in information technology (IT), financial, banking and energy stocks spearheaded the recovery. A sharp rebound in Adani Group stocks also added to the positive momentum.
Sensex surges 2,000 points, Rs 7 lakh crore added: 4 key factors behind rallyThe Sensex was up 2039.44 points to 79,195.23 at 2:57 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 587.90  to 23,938.75.

Bitcoin hits record high, within touching distance of $100,000 milestoneThe world's leading cryptocurrency topped $99,300, coming within striking distance of the psychological milestone that many experts had anticipated after the US election results.

Sensex jumps 1,200 points: 3 things to know about today's stock market bull runThe BSE Sensex climbed 1,193.90 points to cross 78,340.07, while the NSE Nifty advanced 371.50 points to reach 23,721.40.

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points as most Adani Group stocks rebound sharplyStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 1,034.76 points to 78,190.55 by 12:42 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 329.15 points to reach 23,679.05.

Adani Group accused of racial discrimination at Australian coal mining unitAdani Bribery Case: The Nagana Yarrbayn Wangan & Jagalingou Cultural Custodians in Queensland state filed a complaint alleging serious racial discrimination by Bravus Mining and Resources, an Adani Group unit.

Adani bribery case: S&P lowers outlook on 3 Adani units, raises funding concernsGautam Adani Case: S&P expressed concerns that the accusations could erode investor confidence, impair funding access, and escalate borrowing costs for the group.

Zinka Logistics makes tepid market debut: Should investors hold or exit?Zinka Logistics listing: Shares listed at Rs 280.90 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), a 2.89% premium to the issue price of Rs 273. On the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the stock opened at Rs 279.05, reflecting a 2.22% premium.

Ola Electric layoffs: 500 employees likely to lose jobs amid restructuringOla Electric Layoffs News: The move aims to streamline operations, eliminate redundant roles, and enhance profitability. The restructuring process, which began months ago, is expected to conclude by December 2024.

Gold, silver price today, November 22, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Adani Group stocks extend slide amid bribery charges. Details hereAdani Group stocks: This marks the second consecutive session of heavy losses for the conglomerate, with Thursday's rout wiping out Rs 2.25 lakh crore from the group's market capitalisation.

How Sagar Adani's 'bribe notes' unravelled $250 million schemeAdani Bribery Case: At the heart of the complex bribery scheme for which Gautam Adani and his associates have been indicted are the industrialist's nephew Sagar Adani and the detailed "bribe notes" he kept on his mobile phone.

Paytm shares jump 3% today after brokerage Bernstein's update. Should you buy?Paytm share price: With shares up 34% this year and 136% in six months, Paytm's growth potential continues to attract investor interest, although challenges remain.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back; Adani Energy shares down 5%Stock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 496.10 points to 77,651.89, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 72.25 points to 23,422.15

Adani Enterprises, Adani Green, Airtel, LTI, JSW, Zinka: Stocks to watch todayBroader market indices also faced selling pressure, with volatility surging across sectors. As trading opens today, several stocks are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments.
Kenya cancels $700 million deal with Adani Group after US chargesKenya has terminated a $700 million agreement with the Adani Group following a US indictment.

Kenya cancels $730 million proposed deals with Adani Group after US indictmentKenyan President William Ruto has ordered the cancellation of several proposed deals with the Adani Group after the US indicted industrialist Gautam Adani in a bribery case.
Sensex ends over 400 points lower, Nifty dips as Adani shares crashThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 422.59 points to close at 77,155.79, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 168.60 points to settle at 23,349.

Will the US indictment hurt Adani Group's international fund raising plan?Gautam Adani and seven others have been accused of paying Rs 2,029 crore in bribes to secure solar power contracts between 2020 and 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Adani bribery charge sparks political storm: Centre, states react to US claimsUS prosecutors alleged that the Adani Group paid USD 265 million in bribes, with a large chunk directed at officials in Andhra Pradesh, to secure contracts with state electricity distribution companies between 2021-2023.
Delhi air quality slips to 'severe' category again after slight improvementDelhi's air quality, which had shown slight improvement this morning, dipped to 'severe' category again by 6 pm.

Arrest warrant against Gautam Adani was unsealed in US court last monthAdani bribery case: The indictment and the arrest warrant against Gautam Adani were unsealed to provide the documents to foreign law enforcement agencies.

Netanyahu will face arrest if he visits Italy. What about other nations?Benjamin Netanyahu has an arrest warrant against him by the International Criminal Court. While not all nations will act on the warrants, the threat of arrest looms over Netanyahu's potential visits to the ICC's 124 member states.

Ever heard of eyelash dandruff? It is common but riskyEyelash dandruff is barely visible to the naked eye and can pose serious risks if left untreated. Lens wearers should especially be cautious of eyelash dandruff to avoid infections.

Emergency ICC meeting called to discuss Champions Trophy: SourcesThe ICC is set to mediate a critical meeting on November 26 which will include top officials of both BCCI and PCB, aiming to resolve venue concerns for the 2025 Champions Trophy amid escalating tensions and disagreements over safety, hosting rights, and hybrid model proposals.

Apologise or I'll sue: BJP's Vinod Tawde's notice to Rahul Gandhi, 2 othersBJP's Vinod Tawde said he demanded an apology from Congress's Rahul Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge and Supriya Shrinate for their remarks against him in the 'cash-for-votes' row or he would be forced to initiate criminal proceedings against them.

Genius Jasprit Bumrah leads India's stinging counterpunch on 17-wicket Day 1 Reactions Border-Gavaskar Trophy, AUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah led India's fightback with three fiery spells in the final session. 17 wickets fell and Australia were reeling at 67 for 7 at Stumps on Day 1. Batters from both sides failed to adjust to the spicy Perth pitch.

No smog in Delhi then, so what made Tughlaq shift his capitalAn exasperated Shashi Tharoor asked if the national capital should be shifted from "unlivable" Delhi. The first bid to move the capital out of Delhi was made by sultan Muhammad bin Tughlaq in the 14th century. Delhi wasn't smog-hit then, so what made the wisest-fool take the decision?

Yoda Diagnostics Launches 'Beat the Diabetes' Campaign to Raise Awareness and Promote Personalized Diabetes CareEmpowering Personalized Diabetes Care: Yoda Diagnostics' 'Beat the Diabetes' Campaign Promotes Genetic-Based Medication Plans

Adani met Jagan Reddy in 2021, promised bribes, says US regulatorAdani bribery case: The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) alleged that 'incentives' were discussed in the meeting between Adani and Jagan Reddy to secure the solar power agreement.
London airport terminal evacuated after security incident, bomb squad rushedLocated over 48 kilometres south of London, Gatwick Airport is the second busiest in Britain.
Sunita Williams becomes space janitor, cleans Space Station bathroomShe focused on removing components from the waste and hygiene compartment, which serves as the space station's bathroom.

Tamannaah says South vs North debate has 'only caused more havoc'Tamannaah Bhatia and Avinash Tiwary discussed the North vs South film industry debate, urging unity for a pan-India cinema approach. They highlighted the importance of focussing on global influence rather than regional divides.

Perth pitch too spicy? Jasprit Bumrah helps Indian batting unit save faceThe Indian batting line up continued their poor show on Day 1 of the first Test against Australia as they were bundled out for 150. However, the stand-in captain saved their face with his menacing spell. Given the tough surface in Perth, is it fair to blame Indian batters for their poor show?

Nayanthara-Vignesh go unnoticed at Delhi restaurant, wait in line for 30 minutesIn a video that is going viral on social media, Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan are seen waiting in line outside a local restaurant in Delhi to get a table. The couple enjoys their food without being identified as celebrities.

Unlocking sleep tourism: What it is and why you should try itIn today's fast-paced world, many of us long for a break to recharge — sleep tourism offers exactly that. It's a growing trend where travel focusses on rest, relaxation, and quality sleep, helping travellers escape the stresses of everyday life.

Monitor Delhi entry points: Top court takes note of India Today pollution reportDelhi AQI: The Supreme Court blasted the Delhi government after it said that vigil was maintained primarily at 13 major entry points for ensuring compliance with GRAP IV guidelines.

Ukraine, pummeled by Russia now, had world's third-biggest nuclear stockpileUkraine claimed Russia hit it with an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) as the Ukraine-Russia war is seeing a dangerous escalation. Ukraine once had the world's third-largest nuclear weapons stockpile and 179 ICBMS, which could have been a major deterrent, but it handed them over to Russia in a trade-off for identity and independence.

Woman, 25, says HR of Indian company asked her about marriage plans. Internet debatesIn her viral post, Janhvi Jain claimed that the HR representative questioned her age and then asked if she was planning to get married soon after she mentioned being 25.

What are ghost jobs? The truth behind fake job postingsWhile ghost jobs might serve as strategic tools for companies, they leave job seekers chasing shadows, undermining trust in the very platforms meant to connect talent with opportunity.

Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin launches 100th woman in history to spaceThe flight took off from the company's West Texas launch pad at approximately 9:00 pm IST, marking Blue Origin's ninth crewed mission and the 28th overall for the New Shepard program.

With just 72 hours, will Maharashtra be able to avoid President's rule?As Maharashtra Assembly election results are announced on November 23, the parties will have 72 hours to keep the state from President's rule. That's because the term of the current Assembly ends on November 26. A hung Assembly and bickering over the CM's post could delay government formation.

23-year-old Telangana student dies after gun misfires on birthday in US A 23-year-old student from Telangana, lost his life in a gun misfire incident on his birthday. His body is expected to arrive in Telangana tonight.

Rajesh Roshan talks about composing music for Karan ArjunMusic director Rajesh Roshan, in an interview with India Today Digital, reflected on the music created for the iconic film, Karan Arjun, The Rakesh Roshan directorial, re-released in theatres today, November 22.

Mohini Dey on rumours linking her separation to AR RahmanAR Rahman's bassist Mohini Dey reacted to rumours of her link-up with AR Rahman. This happened after Mohini announced her separation from her husband, followed by AR Rahman and his wife.

When Badshah demanded an expensive gift from Shah Rukh KhanRapper and singer Badshah was a guest on Day 1 of Sahitya AajTak. He shared how Shah Rukh arranged a PlayStation 5 for him even before it was released in India.

Alia Bhatt-Raha Kapoor's adorable pic from Akansha Ranjan's photo dump goes viralAlia Bhatt and Raha Kapoor's new unseen picture from Akansha Ranjan Kapoor's photo dump is going viral on social media. In the picture, Akansha can be seen planting a kiss on little Raha's cheek.

However, Mark Waugh and Michael Vaughan jumped to the defence of the two star batters, saying the Perth pitch was too hot to handle on Friday.

Perth Test: Ex-captain Virat Kohli helps stand-in skipper Bumrah. Fans nostalgicA certain section of fans were nostalgic after Virat Kohli was spotted leading India's charge in his aggressive style. Kohli helped out India's stand-in skipper, Bumrah, who was busy dismissing the Australian batters.

Labsuchagne managed to score just two runs off 52 deliveries before Mohammed Siraj trapped him in front of the stumps.

Watch: Kohli's horror day continues after dropping sitter off LabusachagneIND vs AUS: Virat Kohli continued to have a poor day in Perth after dropping an easy catch of Marnus Labuschagne. As the Indian team were celebrating, Kohli indicated to the umpire that he had not taken the catch cleanly.

Watch: Siraj and Marnus engage in heated moment in Perth Test, Kohli joins inAustralia vs India: Mohammed Siraj and Marnus Labuschagne were engaged in a heated exchange on Day 1 of the 1st Test. Labuschagne was eventually dismissed by Siraj for 2 off 52 deliveries.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
